New Records: Gunnar Henderson tied a franchise record for shortstops with his 34th home run.
Chicago dropped to 31-108 and lost its 20th straight game in which Chris Flexen started, setting a major league mark for most consecutive losses in a pitcher’s starts.
The Orioles had their most prolific offensive day since scoring a season-high 17 runs on June 20 against the Yankees and their 18 hits were their most since collecting 18 at Houston on June 21.
Post-Match Reflections: Baltimore manager Brandon Hyde said the win gave his hitters confidence and they had been grinding offensively for a while.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles went 7 for 23 with runners in scoring position and pulled within a percentage point of AL East-leading New York.
Baltimore’s leadoff batter reached in each of the first six innings for the first time since July 4, 1997.
